div.h2: The Berkeley Public Schools Fund is your partner in supporting the emergency needs of Berkeley students and their families during the school closures/COVID-19 crisis.
div.p:
Mary Cazden, Principal of Jefferson Elementary, shares with us some of the impacts
that she has seen from theSchools Fund’s COVID-19 Emergency Assistance Campaign.
div.h3: We’re making Educational Resources Available at the ED HUB in Partnership with BUSD. Learn more here.

h2.span: EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE: Donations are supporting $10,000 a week in emergency assistance to families.
Many parents in our community have lost their jobs and are struggling to support their families. W
orking with the District Office of Family Engagement and Equity, funds are helping with basic needs like food, diapers and hygiene supplies in addition to helping with bills and rent. This c
ommunity support to help stabilize families is
critical for our students and their ability to learn.
BOOKS: Donations fund books for distribution at the District’s free meal sites in addition to literacy coaches ordering books for individual students.

VOLUNTEERS: 500 community members with valuable skills and talents are being mobilized into teams to help with tech assistance and distance learning in addition to helping with distribution of Chromebooks and hands-on activity kits for students.

TECHNOLOGY: Our staff and volunteers are supporting systems for Chromebook distribution by organizing requests, responding to families and enlisting volunteers to clean, package and distribute Chromebooks.

li.h3: TEACHER NEEDS We surveyed teachers and many of them are in need of items that will help them teach effectively from home: desks, computers, keyboards, desk chairs. Take a look at the list of needs here and connect directly with a teacher if you can donate what they’re looking for.

strong.span: THANK YOU volunteers and donors for supporting Berkeley public schools!
